Larry Page. But why? According to sources speaking to the New Yorker, Eric Schmidt 's decision to depart from the role of CEO was intricately linked to Google's decision to pull out of China due to censorship concerns, with Eric Schmidt becoming frustrated when Larry Page and Sergey Brin sided against him in the controversy. Eric Schmidt apparently felt that Google should stay in China, the world's largest developing market, and he "lost some energy and focus after losing the China decision. That loss of focus has had its effect on Google, which has seen many of its most prized engineers jumping ship to Facebook, while more and more governments have begun targeting Google over

posted in recent days. A story published Saturday said Mitch Daniels would be the odds-on favorite for the GOP nomination in 2012 if pundits, conservative columnists and political thinkers represented the party's base. The diminutive Hoosier has nurtured a profile as a mature politician whose outlook extends beyond the next news cycle and whose demeanor exudes seriousness, the story said. "This has been the heart of the problem in Detroit," said Sergio Marchionne , who also heads up Fiat, the Italian auto company. Alan Mulally said Ford has learned that it has to deal with the current reality. You have to match production to real demand and accelerate development of new products that people will want to buy.
